Fields.DialogueText: Zzz.... where speculation ends in real life, positive science begi... zzz...
Zzz... AUGH!
Boiky? Status report!
Mgh'nlgh gh'zlyat fl--
Boiky! What's wrong?
Zzz-- AAAAH!
Gde ya? Oy... ... Privet, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: What's going on? You were screaming in your sleep.
Are you all right?
I know you talk in your sleep a lot, but this is a bit much even for you.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't sleeptalk *that* often. Anyway, this was different.
Shtoh ty valnooyeshsya? I'm fine, Kapitan.
Nichego vazhnogo.
I had a nightmare. That's all.
Where's the navigator?
Huh? He's probably sleeping. Why?
We're changing course.
Huh? --We are absolutely *not.*
Not without some *discussion.*
*ALARM*
He's awake now.
Morganas first, discussion later.
@BATTLE
All right. The Rusalki are gone. Do we *have* to talk about changing course?
*Absolutely.*
If we're going to defy orders, I need you to explain what you want to accomplish here.
Zatknis’. You don't understand.
I can't understand if you won't tell me what's going on.
.... All right. Get me a map.
You see how we're down here, at the southwest?
Mm. We're supposed to be patrolling behind Copenhagen and Kiel.
I seem to remember you *wanted* this assignment, so you could keep an eye on the "fascist vermin?"
Believe me, Kaptan, I do.
So what's with this sudden course change?
I had a nightmare.

Fields.MenuText: And that... changes things how?
That's a flimsy reason to change course...
... Dreams are important to Belles, aren't they?

Fields.DialogueText: You'll have to ask Comrade Aurora about that.
She's forgotten more than most of us will ever know.
It isn't. I didn't tell you what I saw.
Da. You didn't see it, Kaptan.
... In my nightmare, Kapitan... I saw a city.
I wonder if she remembers the city.
The whatnow?
See *what?* I don't get it.
A... city?
A city that looked like the deck of a Morgana.
It rose out of the sea like - like... I can't even describe it. ... It looked like it was cutting the world apart.
Just looking at it felt like stabbing needles through my eyes.
Lovely mental image.
But we need to go up here. Towards the Gulf of Finland.
Right? So we need to go there.
@BATTLE
Why?
We need to see what's going on. If it's connected to the Rusalki, we need to destroy it.
You think it really exists?
You think I'm an idiot?
No. ... I'll see what I can do.
Khorosho. I'll tell the navigator.
Wait--
This girl... she's too much.
So? Can we move yet?
I wired Geneva. They're deliberating.
Deliberating?! How long should this take to decide?
*Bliiiiiin,* there's a weird city in the ocean, what should we dooooo about it?

Fields.MenuText: Whoa, slow down. We need more evidence.
Dreams aren't enough evidence. That's superstitious.
If we're going to do something this dangerous, we should at least resupply first.

Fields.DialogueText: Superstitious for *humans*, maybe. But I *know* what I saw!
Evidence? You don't trust me?
You're not *wrong*, but this is *urgent.*
I trust that you saw what you saw. I don't know how much I trust dreams.
It might be. It might not be.
You don't trust me, Kapitan?
You didn't *see* it.
*I know what I saw.*
I believe you. I believe you! It's just--
Humans have dreams about things that aren't real all the time.
I mean, so do I! I once had a dream where I had to debate Marx and I wasn't wearing any pants.
This was different. Swear on my eyeteeth.
*ALARM*
Look, a distraction.
Zatknees, Kaptan. You're lucky you're cute.
@BATTLE
Cute?
I said what I said.
Yes, thank you. I'll let her know ASAP.
KAPITAN-- KAPITAN, WHERE'S THE COFFEE--
Sssssh! --Yes, thank you. Goodbye.
Ohhhh, you're on the phone. Prosti!
I'm not anymore.
Ah! What was that about? It's getting pretty late.
Well, that was Geneva.
Neuzhto? What did they say?
They said that our scouts *have* found something strange, right in the part of the Baltic you said the city was in.
*I told you.*

Fields.MenuText: And I believed you!
You did, and I should have listened.
Trust, but verify.

Fields.DialogueText: And next time, you will! Right?
Is this enough proof, or do I have to kick it into your head with both feet?
That really won't be necessary.
Right.
You had a very strange way of showing it.
I didn't want to make you promises I couldn't keep.
So? Are we changing course?
We are. I've already given the navigator the coordinates.
Spasibo, Kapitan. You won't regret this.
*ALARM*
... Urgh.
Ah, look. The reason we were patrolling *here.*
Let's drive them along our new course.
@BATTLE
Mm. All's fair in love and war.
Boiky? What are you doing up this late?
Making coffee.
... Really? Seems like it's a bit late for that.
Time is a bourgeois construct. And anyway, I don't want to go back to sleep.

Fields.MenuText: Are you overworking yourself again, or are you scared you'll have nightmares?
You *never* want to sleep.
If you don't perform system maintenance, your system will perform it for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Sleep isn't maintenance. Not right now, at least.
Sleep is *mandatory* maintenance.
I don't like wasting time!
*Sigh* We've had this conversation before...
And as long as you keep pestering me about it, we'll have it again and again!
Mm, I don't want to sleep right now. Does the reason why matter?
It does. You're off-duty, you deserve your rest.
If I'm having nightmares, sleep isn't restful.
Ah. That'd do it, wouldn't it...?
So I'm making coffee. Do you want some?
*ALARM*
... Yes. Yes, I think I need some coffee.
Ya pozabochus' ob etom.
@BATTLE
The Åland islands look so peaceful.
Mm. Look there, and there, and over there. You see them?
Old fortifications...
From the Great War. The Empire built them.
... It's really funny, isn't it?
What is?
The Tsar and his cronies were so afraid to lose their power, they'd cover tiny islands like these in forts. They tore down a lighthouse just so the Germans couldn't see them.
But they couldn't see the proletariat. They were so scared of losing their power that they went blind.

Fields.MenuText: Tearing down a lighthouse *does* do that to you.
We shouldn't speak ill of the dead.
At least *some* of these fortifications will probably help with the Morganas, right?

Fields.DialogueText: If they haven't been put to use yet, we'll repurpose them!
I do not speak ill of anyone who starved while the Romanovs feasted. Do you?
They'd do anything for a better firing line.
... We'll have to agree to disagree.
Sounds like someone else I know.
Your optimism is an inspiration to us all.
I just think it's funny, that's all.
*ALARM*
Blyat. How'd they sneak up on us?
Maybe we needed a lighthouse.
@BATTLE
Can you feel it, Kapitan?
Feel what?
The City.
The one from your nightmares?
*Da, tochno tak.*
It feels like boredom feels.
... You keep talking about boredom like it's... alive.
Isn't it, though?

Fields.MenuText: Only boring people get bored.
It's a little *too* familiar. Stop staring into my soul.
I keep myself busy. Can't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I can. I do. The alternative is letting it eat me alive.
Bah! Are you calling me boring?
Wouldn't dare it. But you could stand to complain a little less.
You fight *every* battle like it's your last.
Never.
It could be!
Says the complainer.
I mean it. If you keep describing my life like this, I'm going to get my head examined.
You calling me crazy?
Unstable, maybe. But that's beside the point.
*ALARM*
Maybe you were just sensing the Morganas?
Morganas are crunchy. The City is stabby.
... I'm not even going to question it...
@BATTLE
... Oh, no. I think I see what you mean.
About the City?
How could you tell?
You have a headache.

Fields.MenuText: I do not.
How could you tell?
Very clever.

Fields.DialogueText: You pinch your nose like that when I make an unconventional attack.
Do too.
Do *not.*
Do *too.*
... This argument's pointless.
I do? Huh.
Also, I saw you take an aspirin earlier.
That's me.
But seriously, Kapitan, Look out for yourself.
Might be. Who knows.
I promise I will.
Good. And if you can't, I'll look out for you.
*ALARM*
That is... a *lot* of Morganas.
It is! Just what the doctor ordered.
Really?
The best cure for a headache is catharsis, nyet?
If you say so.
@BATTLE
*WHSSSSSSH--*
That's a strong wind. It's pushing us back--
Yes, but look ahead.
....Whoa.
Do you see why I wanted the nightmares to end?
I... I can't look at it straight on.
It's... It's like looking at the guts of a Morgana... but the guts are....
This city is a gaping wound.
Ribs here. Guts there. Eyes *everywhere.*

Fields.MenuText: I... I see why you needed the nightmares to stop.
I need a bath. Three baths.
You were right. We need to blow this thing off the planet.

Fields.DialogueText: With bleach.
That sounds like a good way to give yourself chemical burns.
Khorosho. Aiming now.
Wait. We need a *plan* first.
"Needed?" It's still there, isn't it?
Good point. We *need* to stop your nightmares.
What are we waiting for, Kapitan?
We've never seen anything like this before. We need a plan of attack. Possibly reinforcements.
Bah. We have the firepower.
Firepower without a plan is just a liability.
Fine. But we've got to act quickly.
Why?
*They're* coming.
*ALARM*
What did I tell you?
@BATTLE
Lovely place for a rendezvous.
We can't see the City from here.
Fair. It's still hot as Hell's armpit.
Good. That heat pushes us on.
Uh-huh. Anyway. The plan.
Hit me.
You want your nightmares to go away. And you say we need to destroy the city to make this happen. Right?
Khorosho. You're a good listener.
I try.
We need to destroy the City to make my nightmares go away, da. There's... something *in* it. Something that's...
It screams. Can't you hear it?

Fields.MenuText: Do I *want* to?

Fields.DialogueText: Of *course* not. Just my luck I can.
You'll have to trust me. It's *horrible.*
You're worth trusting, Boiky.
You're too much.
So. Seems to me we wouldn't have to blow everything up. If we can find the screamer--
You want to send someone in there?
No. But there has to be a way to target a strike--
*ALARM*
Wonderful. We found *a* screamer.
You can take Mistrust.
Of course I can. She's a direct threat to our revolution.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: No, but I believe you.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Spasibo, Kapitan. I'm surprised you would, if you can't hear.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not good with ... Belle magic.

Fields.DialogueText: Then you'll have to trust me, Kapitan. It's as ugly as you are beautiful.
If we were having a secret affair, I would have told you sooner. There is a reason for my choice, Kapitan.
How can you keep complimenting me at a time like this?
Talent.
Something wrong?
Other than the obvious, no.
You're squinting *really* hard at that paper.
It's... correspondence with a friend.
Mm.
Kapitan... do you think a Rusalka sent this letter?
What?
... Rusalki can intercept the mail. I don't know if this is a legitimate letter or...
Or Rusalki counter-revolution!
... Mm. What does the letter say?
You said we'd need reinforcements. I asked her for help.
"I wish I could lend you a hand with your 'quest.' Regrettably, my orders restrict me to the coast of the Fatherland..."
"If my duties change, I'd love to catch up. But for now, I'm afraid you'll have to handle this on your own. My sincere condolences."
You see what I mean?

Fields.MenuText: Hm... I don't know. That *does* sound like Nürn...

Fields.DialogueText: They're good at mimicking voices.
I hate this. I *hate* this!
Boiky--
Why does this have to be *complicated?*
I didn't want to be friends with a fascist. But I had to go running my mouth about sisterhood and camaraderie- -
And then I just wanted to be *friends* with my friends, but she's being a *snake* about it!
...Or the Morganas are.
We *did* just run into Mistrust.
*ALARM*
Looks like she's back for a second helping.
She wants to gorge herself like a bourgeois pig? I'll stuff her with lead.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: You're right, that *does* sound off.

Fields.DialogueText: Right? I can't tell if she's sincere or if she's laughing at me or--

Fields.MenuText: She's doing her duty. Nothing strange about that.

Fields.DialogueText: "We must ourselves decide our duty."
... Modifying your guns again?
Mm. We're preparing for an all-out assault, aren't we?
You're not going to use your old guns as ammo again, are you?
Of course not, Kapitan. I've learned the error of my ways.
Oh no.
What's with that look?
Sorry, Boiky. It's just, when you say that...

Fields.MenuText: You're *dangerous* when you learn things.
I'm remembering the last time you learned something new.
You've got a *look* in your eye.

Fields.DialogueText: You *like* it.
I'm *always* learning new things. We can't move forward without it.
I'm always dangerous!
I understand that. But you understand why I'm skittish.
Of course! Even most of my Comrades wouldn't come up with *this* idea--
*Oh no.*
Conventional bombardment may not work. We don't know what materials this place is made of. But if we can do any damage to the City...
We can use it against itself. Magnify the contradictions--
Wait, wait. Are you suggesting firing chunks of the city at the city?!
Fight fire with fire, Kapitan.
*ALARM*
Shall we also fight Mistrust with Fire?
We'll make it work.
@BATTLE
And you *like* that about me, don't you?
I do.
You're a real brat.
You like *that,* too.
*BOOM*
I can't believe we're doing this.
Which part?
All of it. It's madness all the way down.
War is madness-- hey, back gun, a little to the left!
*BOOM*
Ugh. We're not even making a dent.
As I expected, Captain!
We've broken some chunks off, look.
Fist-sized chunks.
Every riot starts with a single brick.
Ever the optimist.
Stations, people! -- Damn, that's a *lot* of Morganas.
Blyat-- don't talk like that, Kapitan! Now we've got trouble.
You think they're here to defend their homeland?

Fields.MenuText: You think it matters?
They're not people. I don't think they have one.
Maybe. Who knows what Morganas want?

Fields.DialogueText: Well said, Kapitan.
They're a book behind seven seals, it's true.
It doesn't. They need to go down, no matter what.
Let's blow them off the map.
Them first, and the City second.
@BATTLE
They just keep coming, don't they?
We'll have to keep fighting them off!
@BATTLE
That was grueling.
Don't insult gruel like that. It's tasty and filling. That battle was neither.
Fair enough. Status report?
I'll live. The City, on the other hand...
It barely looks like we did anything to it.
That's where you're wrong, Kapitan. We dislodged a few chunks in the fight with the Rusalki.
Those chunks will be this city's undoing!
Uh-*huh.* Because of your new gun mods?
Got it in one.
I don't know what the City's made of. But it's hard and sharp.
Fight fire with fire.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure this is a good idea?
At this point, I'd try anything that will let us go back to our primary objective.
Maybe we just need better guns.

Fields.DialogueText: I will *never* say no to more firepower.
Let's make the arrangements, then.
Nyet! But it's an idea that works, and those are in short supply.
We won't know if it works before we test it...
Me too.
We've got to destroy the City. We have to give it everything we can.
As long as we walk away from it in one piece.
FIRE!
*BOOM*
Still not budging. I thought you were onto something.
I did too.
Ty syn sirotskogo der'moyeda, ya pokazhu tebe, gde raki spyat zimoy!
If swearing could tear a city down, we'd have razed it by now.
Right?! I'd huff and puff and blow it down.
I believe you. As is... how's it coming?
Well, we've done minimal damage to some of the bigger towers.
Structurally, it's still stable. In fact...
What is it? You've got a strange look...
Pull back, Kapitan. NOW.
You heard the Belle, pull back! --What's wrong?
It's *healing.*
What?
The City... is putting itself... back together.

Fields.MenuText: Let me get a visual on that.
You're serious? That's the last thing we need.
Cities can't *do* that.

Fields.DialogueText: Is this like any city you've ever seen before?
Serious as revolution, Kapitan. Look, there.
You don't trust me? Fine. See for yourself.
... Pulling itself back together at the foundations.
Disgusting, right?
*ALARM*
Damn Rusalki. Why are there so many of them?!
I don't know. Stations, people!
@BATTLE
Your captain doesn't believe you...
Zhopu porvu margala vikoliu!
No one believes you. They all think you're insane.
Who believes in living cities... silly girl...
You're a filthy liar. My Kapitan loves me!
I lie as much as your friend Nürn--
Leave her out of this!
I'm going to destroy the City, no matter what anyone says!
I'll enjoy destroying you *both.*
Rip your *eyeballs* out--
@BATTLE
... Ugh. I'm spent.
Me too.
It almost seems like...
What?
Like they're being drawn to this place.
Just like I was.

Fields.MenuText: Hm, I don't know...
I can buy it. Maybe this place drives Belles mad.
Maybe we should leave the city standing, and use it as bait.

Fields.DialogueText: And have those nightmares forever? Nyet. Not a chance.
I'm just surprised it doesn't work on humans.
... Do you trust me, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, of course.
I trust that you see what you say what you're saying.

Fields.DialogueText: So that's a solid "nyet."
Thank you, Kapitan. I'm glad.
I'll try to ignore what that... that... that *waste of materiel* said.
I do trust you. I'm just... worried.
You think I don't know what I'm seeing?
I think... the situation's got you confused. But I don't think you're *wrong.* If that makes any sense?
It makes enough sense.
Sometimes that's all you can do.
Staring at the City again? You're going to go mad that way.
Maybe. It will be worth it.
I was thinking. About what Mistrust said.
Whether or not you trust me. I haven't trusted you enough, either.
No?
Nyet.
I get. Single-minded. Sometimes.
... I lose sight of anything but my immediate goal.

Fields.MenuText: That's a strength and a weakness.
We work around it.
It's really frustrating.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Imagine how it is for me, Kapitan. My whole world narrows down to a single point.
*You* work around it. I leave you to suffer. But that's not the point.
Today, it's a weakness. Tomorrow, who knows?
And until I break that point open, I can't get the world back.
--Anyway.
Earlier. You had a thought. And I ignored it.
But it might be the spark for this fuse.
Oh? What's--
*ALARM*
Ah. The counter-revolution's back.
She really doesn't want us to talk, does she?
Which is why it's crucial we do. Cut through the fog of war.
@BATTLE
So. What are we looking for? You said it was something I said?
The screamer.
Huh?
If there's a scream, you said, there will be a screamer.
If the City's screaming is what's giving me nightmares, then stopping the screamer will stop the nightmares.

Fields.MenuText: Seems sensible enough.
Thank you for taking my advice.
It was just an idea. Don't take it as gospel.

Fields.DialogueText: Pozhaluysta. I have a clever Kapitan.
Why shouldn't we adopt yours? My idea wasn't working.
No, but that's nothing to be ashamed of.
Of course you'd say that. It was your idea.
... I feel foolish for not going along with it sooner.
I didn't trust you enough.
Oh, dear. Boiky... you don't need to listen to Mistrust...
If I was listening to her, I wouldn't trust you. Would I?
No, but--
*ALARM*
We've made contact!
On two fronts. Look - I think that's the screamer.
Oh, she's gonna scream, all right--
@BATTLE
That's definitely her, Kapitan! Can't you hear it?
I can't hear anything over the gunfire! She's quiet as death.
Agh! You're so blind sometimes, Kapitan!
Vernut'sya ko mne.
Past’ zabej, padla jebanaja!
Du kannst nicht für immer weglaufen. Komm zu mir zurück.
What's going on? I can't understand her--
She's full of it, Kapitan! She's saying--
"Return to me."

Fields.MenuText: The hell does that mean?
Your home's with us. Don't listen to her!
Oh, we'll send *her* back home, all right--

Fields.DialogueText: Great minds think alike, mm?
I don't intend to.
Who cares?
Bambina ribelli. Torna o muori.
"Rebellious"? Hah! Hahahahaha!
An ancient empire couldn't force me to kneel.
What makes *you* think *you* have a chance?! Yobanaya suka.
Watch your six, Boiky - we've got more company!
More Rusalki? More things to destroy!
... Reviens-moi.
@BATTLE
BLYAAAAT-- get out of my WAY--
You don't think I'll do it? Fine. I won't do it.
Do what?
I won't do it. My guns are on you--
She's lying. Look where she's aiming!
She's pointed... at the City? But why--

Fields.MenuText: Does it matter? Morganas do what they want.
If she's attacking our enemy, let her.
I'll put some of the lab boys on it. For now, let her do what she wants.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know if they'd believe her if they hadn't seen her. But I'll trust your judgment.
The enemy of our enemy is our enemy in a funny hat.
It matters if "what she wants" is to blast us to pieces!
Right now, all you need to do is stay out of her way.
... Da, Kapitan.
But I'm not going to like it.
@BATTLE
... I can't believe my eyes.
Terrifying. Isn't it?

Fields.MenuText: I know why we can't let them tear apart cities, but... it's awe-inspiring.
It is. I'm glad we're not on the recieving end.
I'm not terrified. I'm angry.

Fields.DialogueText: We might be, if we spare them.
As you should be.
... Like an earthquake.
Or a hurricane.
Take that anger and let it fuel your resolve. We'll destroy them.
I told you, Boiky, we're waiting.
We've got to stop them soon. There's only so much City left.
For what?
They're doing our job for us.
I understand, but--
But what?
It should be me. I started this. I want to be the one to end it.
Boiky...
If I don't, the City will keep screaming in my head. And neither you nor Nürnberg will ever believe me.
Nürnberg?
... My... correspondence friend.
... Let's worry about your pen pal's opinion of you *after* the battle.
@BATTLE
You didn't run?!
Baaaaaaah! I run *to* my enemies, not away from them!
I ran *to* this City to destroy it. And *you* got in my way!
(That's not how I remember it...)
(Stop, Kapitan! I'm trying to put the fear of us into her!)
I-I'm the one who destroyed it! Not you!
Stop... backing me up..
L-look behind you. The other ships in your fleet-- they're taking aim--
Do pizdy, Rusalka.
(Look behind us?)

Fields.MenuText: Why? You don't actually think--
They're my Belles too, Boiky. They won't shoot.
"Gullible" is written on the ceiling.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't make fun of me, Kapitan!
You looked up.
I know, just - look back, just in case.
For you? Fine.
Peace of mind, Captain.
I did *not!* Just - just to be sure. Look back?
Oh, f--
What! What is it?
Don't... turn... around...
@BATTLE
Kapitan? What's behind us?
Modotte kuru.
Kapitan? What do we do? If even the Morganas couldn't--
We run.
Nyet!
If even the Morganas demolishing her didn't kill her--
Wait. Wait.
Mm?
Son of a-- Nyet.
Nyeeeeeeh.
What's wrong?
If I tell her about the City hurting the City, will that do anything to *us?*

Fields.MenuText: We don't even know that works.
It shouldn't. The metal doesn't seem any different from normal metal.
Why give them more weapons?

Fields.DialogueText: I know what I saw.
So you think I should tell her?
You're probably right.
But--
What happened to "the enemy of my enemy is my enemy in a funny hat?"
Pragmatism, Kapitan.
Let's get her attention.
-- All right, but let's do it carefully.
@BATTLE
You know me.
Yes, that's the problem.
Ey! Ey, chuvák!
Still here? You can go f--
I know how to destroy it. The City. You have to trust me.
Ya znayu. Your name is literally the opposite of that. But if you listen--
*BOOM*
She's firing on us! We pull back.
@BATTLE
How is she still floating?
I - I thought we sank her.
Can't be helped. I'll call in reinforcements.
Wait-- Kapitan, look--
It's the metal! The stuff she's made of. Hit her with it, she goes down--
*BOOM*
... She's charging.
An all-out suicide attack. ... Heh.
Heh. Hehehehe. Hah.

Fields.MenuText: That's ghoulish laughter even for you.
Good of her to make our job easier.
I don't get it. What's so funny?

Fields.DialogueText: She - hah- trusted me.
Right? Hah. Haaaaa.
Ghoulish? Is that some reactionary sympathy, Kapitan?
I just don't get what's funny about it.
Can't believe she did it.
Did what?
Isn't that the funniest damn thing.
And it *worked* - look out there.
... It's sinking...
The entire thing. Beneath the waves.
Won't trouble any of us anymore.
And... it's because... Mistrust... *trusted* me.... how is that not funny!
... So this place was made of whatever Morganas are made of?
Guess so.
If you weren't having such bad nightmares... I'd say we shouldn't have sunk it.
Know thy enemy?
Something like that.
... My gut says you don't need to worry.
We'll run into another one. Eventually.
When that happens? Poke it all you like. For now...
*YAWN*
Are you going to take a nap?
Nnnnn. Maybe.
Give it a try. You deserve it.
zzzzzzz......
... Thank goodness. A nap over a table is still a nap.
I'll just put my jacket over her shoulders--
A spider conducts operations that resemble those of a weaver--!
Oh. Morning, Boiky.
... you let me wear your jacket?
There's ink *all* over your face.
... Mmm. Must have fallen asleep while I was writing.
Writing is boring. I don't know how anyone does it for long.
Mmm. A letter to your pen pal?
That's it, exactly. I told her that we didn't need her help after all.
You don't sound too happy about that.
... I don't know how to say it.
Say what?
Her last letter was... let's put it this way.
... If that letter was Mistrust, I don't want to cut too hard. If it was her, I'll cut to the bone.

Fields.MenuText: Tone is hard.
Just tell her how you feel.
Cut away. Just don't start a diplomatic incident.

Fields.DialogueText: She wasn't very diplomatic, Kapitan.
That's what I'd normally do. I don't know why it's so hard now!
I don't normally *have* to care! I just say what I mean!
You'll figure it out. I believe in you.
Priviet.
Oh, I meant to ask...
Mm?
You sleeping okay now?
Da, Kapitan. I didn't have a single nightmare. I dreamed of nothing at all.
That's good. ... You needed that, didn't you?
... Well, I hope I won't need it again soon. There are more interesting things I could be doing.
Sure there are.
Whaaaaat?
Nothing, nothing. It's good to have you back, Boiky.
I'm happy to be back. And hopefully...
Mm?
Next time I have to sleep... I'll dream of worldwide revolution!
You looked cold and tired. If I'd had a blanket, that's what you'd get.
Pragmatic *and* romantic. I like that about you.
